page.title: 18Home Life in Burford 1945
page.content: Services available in Burford in 1945 included mains water and electricity. Most homes were heated by open fires. Cooking was done on electric stoves and cooking ranges.Freezers were unknow and refrigerators rare.Jam making and bottling were common ways of preserving food.Washing machines were unusual and and Mondays wereÂ£washing' days.Local people bought their clothes in Burford shops or from local dressmakers.They They did their weekly shopping in Burford as there were more food shops then.Two bakers and three butchers and travelling shops made deliveries in the local villages.Good bus services connected with train services and distant towns.People travelled locally by bicycle or on foot.Few people owned a car or telephone.Communication was mainly by letter with two posts a day.
